metadata.titleEn: WATER: Dataset of intensive rain gauges observations in the arid region hydrology experiment area
metadata.description:
The dataset of intensive rain gauges observations was obtained in the arid region hydrology experiment area, in cooperation with dual polarized doppler radar observations. There was no single dataset for the upper stream observations for the poor quality; the middle stream dataset was collected by 29 RG3-M self-recording rain gauges: the northernmost (100.36°E, 39.16°N), the southernmost (100.34°E, 38.61°N), the easternmost (100.62°E, 38.87°N), and the westernmost (100.26°E, 38.82°N). Rain gauges R02-R09 measured from May 18 to Oct. 9, 2008, and R10-R30 from May 26 to Oct. 9, 2008. The technique criterions of these rain gauges were :
     (1) caliber: 165mm×254mm
     (2)  the temperature range:  0°C —+70°C
     (3)  resolution: 0.2mm
     (4)  the measuring range: 0—320cm
     (5)  the measuring accuracy: 1%

Concept Completion.Question: What are the main technical specifications of the RG3-M type automatic tipping bucket rain gauges used in the Heihe River Basin midstream hydrological experiment?
Concept Completion.Answer: Catchment diameter 165mm×254mm temperature measurement range 0°C to +70°C resolution 0.2mm measurement range 0 to 320cm measurement accuracy 1%

Feature Specification.Question: What are the key specifications and precision details of the instruments used in hydrological data collection in arid regions?
Feature Specification.Answer: measurement inlet 165mm×254mm, temperature measurement range 0°C to +70°C, resolution 0.2mm, measurement range 0 to 320cm, measurement accuracy 1%

Quantification.Question: How many automatic rain gauge units were used for data collection in the middle reaches arid zone hydrological experiment area?

Causal Antecedent.Question: What factors lead to the need for increased density of rain gauge observations in arid region hydrological experiments?
Causal Antecedent.Answer: The need for increased density of rain gauge observations in arid region hydrological experiments arises from the requirement to support observations with dual-polarization Doppler radar and the necessity to accurately capture precipitation patterns in areas with low rainfall and high variability. The deployment of multiple rain gauges helps improve the precision and reliability of rainfall data in these conditions.

Instrumental/Procedural.Question: What procedures and technologies are used to ensure accurate and precise data collection with rain gauges in arid regions?
Instrumental/Procedural.Answer: In the field, 29 RG3-M type automatic tipping bucket rain gauges are used for data collection in an arid region hydrological test area. The technological specifications include a water inlet diameter of 165mm×254mm, a temperature measurement range of 0°C to +70°C, a resolution of 0.2mm, a measurement range of 0—320cm, and a measurement accuracy of 1%. The rain gauges are strategically placed across the test area, with specific geographical coordinates marking the northernmost, southernmost, easternmost, and westernmost locations. These gauges were operational from May to October 2008, ensuring data collection over different seasonal conditions.
